result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chas D Merriweather

records.addlTxt:
1:35 PM   File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Chas D Merriweather in court by zoom with attorney Anna M Kees.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Kees requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

dated 06-27-2022 from Atty. Anna Kees, requesting to adjourn the 06-29-2022 hearing; 
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 06-27-2022:  granted - okay to reset.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:29 AM Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chas D Merriweather in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:08 AM Defendant Chas D Merriweather in court by zoom video with Public Defender Intern, in person for attorney Anna M Kees.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Request to appear by zoom.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 04-04-2022. Granted
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives/taser/pepper spray.

10:50 AM Defendant Chas D Merriweather in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
